title: Fiduciary Manager
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Fiduciary Manager as part of the Trust Account
Opening and Maintenance team within Wealth and Investment Management
Operations. This team supports the account opening process for Wells Fargo
trust accounts and serves as an escalation point for trust officers, financial
advisors and clients. The team is also responsible for day-to-day asset
maintenance, providing account governance and reporting and meeting compliance
standards set by regulators.  
  
The Fiduciary Manager will manage a team of senior fiduciary specialists while
ensuring the firm's trust and agency account administration and best-in-class
trust services experience for advisors and clients. Additionally, the manager
will drive process improvement and risk control development to ensure trust
account services are managed consistently. Learn more about our career areas
and lines of business at
[wellsfargojobs.com](https://www.wellsfargojobs.com/career-areas/).

  
****In this role, you will:****

  * Manage and develop a team senior fiduciary specialists with moderate complexity and risk in Fiduciary Management Services, promoting growth, profit management, and risk management

  * Engage stakeholders and partners within the Trust Services functional area

  * Assign accounts and ensure relationships are managed according to fiduciary policies and procedures to ensure satisfactory audits and service standards

  * Identify and recommend opportunities for process improvement and risk control development within the Fiduciary Management Services office

  * Lead team in new business-related efforts and acquisitions, retain or expand current relationships and coach on business development investment strategies

  * Review documents, negotiate fees, and approve discretionary distributions up to appropriate amount

  * Make decisions and resolve issues regarding objectives and operations of Fiduciary Management Services team to meet business objectives

  * Implement estate plans and collaborate with investment and risk partners to ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations

  * Provide fiduciary oversight and answer moderately complex questions regarding trust taxability, document interpretation, and fiduciary risk management

  * Collaborate with Trust Services leadership, risk partners and other regional leaders to ensure consistent execution and quality of service

  * Manage allocation of people and financial resources for Fiduciary Products

  * Mentor and guide talent development of direct reports and assist in hiring talent

****Required Qualifications:****

  * 4+ years of Fiduciary Products experience or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

  * 2+ years of Leadership experience

  
****Desired Qualifications:****

  * 4+ years of Trust or Brokerage experience

  * 2+ years of Financial Services operations experience

  * Strong knowledge of process improvement and business transformation practices

  * Ability to develop, retain, and manage client relationships

  * Ability to effectively assess stakeholder, partner, or client needs while consulting, building solutions, and developing processes

  * Strong people management and demonstrated leadership skills including coaching, training, and mentoring

  * Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

  * Certified Trust and Financial Advisor (CTFA) designation

  * Advanced Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word) skills

****Job Expectations:****

  * Ability to work a hybrid schedule

  * Willingness to work on-site at stated location on the job opening

  * This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship

description:
**About Wells Fargo India & Philippines**  
Wells Fargo India & Philippines (WFIP) enables global talent capabilities for
Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines
and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and
Knowledge Services. WFIP operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India
and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about WFIP at our International Careers
website.

**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Control Management Specialist who will be part of the
team that performs evidence-based control testing which may involve sampling
and inspecting evidence to assess the design and operating effectiveness of
controls and whether they are mitigating the assigned risks. This role will
help in strengthening the business control environment through proactive
evaluation of controls, identification of issues and by providing consultative
guidance to the front-line business groups. For this role, we are looking for
a candidate with good understanding of risk management, operational risk and
control evaluation/ testing methodologies with an ability to assess the design
and operating effectiveness of controls for medium to high complex processes.
The role requires engagement with multiple stakeholders, providing credible
challenge and an ability to identify and report potential control gaps in the
business processes.

  
**In this role, you will:**

  * Participate in identifying, assessing, managing, and mitigating current and emerging risk exposures within Control Management functional area
  * Provide risk management consulting to support the business in designing and implementing risk mitigation strategies, business processes, and business controls
  * Monitor moderately complex business specific programs and provide risk management consulting to support the business in designing and implementing risk mitigation strategies
  * Monitor, measure, evaluate, and report on the impact of decisions and controls to the relevant business group or functional area
  * Provide guidance to business groups on the development, implementation, and monitoring of business specific programs to identify, assess, and mitigate risk
  * Collaborate with relevant business group to identify current and emerging risks associated with business activities and operations

  
**Required Qualifications:**

  * 4+ years of Risk Management or Control Management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

  
**Required Qualifications for Europe, Middle East & Africa only:**

**Desired Qualifications:**

  * Candidate must be a graduate of a bachelor's degree or higher. Relevant certifications will be an advantage.
  * Candidate must have an overall experience of 5+ years with 2 years of relevant experience in Financial Services industry and / or risk & control domains covering operational risk, controls testing / evaluation,  compliance, internal audit, risk management etc.
  * Experience in automation / advanced excel / reporting will be an advantage.
  * General knowledge of industry standards and best practices around control evaluations / testing, internal audit and risk management processes.
  * Experience creating test questions or test scripts  
  * Experience assessing control design and performance through testing, audit or Risk Control Self-Assessment practices
  * Experience assessing processes, procedures and identifying controls
  * Experience in assessing risk, reviewing risk ratings, identifying control gaps and determining the appropriate evaluation methodology
  * Candidate must be amenable to work on a mid-shift and be located at McKinley Hill, Taguig.

**Job Expectations:**

  * Comprehensive understanding of operational risk management in the financial services or other highly regulated industries
  * Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy.
  * Excellent verbal, written, interpersonal communication skills and stakeholder management.
  * Demonstrate positive attitude and readiness to work in a challenging and dynamic environment.
  * Flexibility to multi task and work across domains and business groups.
  * Ability to credibly challenge, conduct tough conversations and effectively communicate with various levels of management
  * Ability to synthesize data from a variety of sources and deliver results quickly.

  * Review and analyze basic business challenges that require research, evaluation, and selection of alternatives
  * Develop and implement risk monitoring, risk reporting processes, and controls while evaluating and reporting results where necessary
  * Present recommendations for resolving complex situations and exercise independent judgment while developing Control Management functional area expertise
  * Provide support in the interpretation of policy, guidelines, and governance programs as front line liaison to Independent Risk Management area
  * Collaborate and consult with Control Management team and key stakeholders, including internal customers
  * Individual contributor role focusing on performing evidence based control evaluations by conducting various evidence gathering activities.
  * Design, maintain and execute the control evaluation scripts, identify control deficiencies, document and escalate potential issues to appropriate stakeholders.
  * Validate & track action plans, escalate issues as required and document the control test artifacts and findings.
  * Perform control evaluations for moderate to complex engagements, challenge status-quo and identify opportunities to add efficiencies or refining the existing processes.
  * Engage and work with multiple stakeholders - front line business groups, risk program aligned functions and IRM teams for driving the objectives of risk and control programs.

description:
**About Wells Fargo I &P**  
  
Wells Fargo India & Philippines (WFIP) enables global talent capabilities for
Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines
and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and
Knowledge Services. WFIP operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India
and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about WFIP at our International Careers
website.

  
**Department Overview**  
  
We evaluate whether controls are well-designed and operating effectively. Our
approach is tailored around Risk and Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) and other
risk programs and it supports proactive risk management in alignment with the
Risk Management Framework. We perform evidence-based controls evaluations and
document our outcomes based on applicable policies and standards.  
  
**About the Role**  
  
The controls evaluation team performs evidence based control testing which may
involve sampling and inspecting evidence to assess the design and operating
effectiveness of controls and whether they are mitigating the assigned risks.

proactive evaluation of controls, identification of issues and by providing
consultative guidance to the front line business groups. For this role, we are
looking for a candidate with good understanding of risk management,
operational risk and control evaluation/ testing methodologies with an ability
to assess the design and operating effectiveness of controls for medium to
high complex processes. The role requires engagement with multiple
stakeholders, providing credible challenge and an ability to identify and
report potential control gaps in the business processes.

  * Bachelor's degree or higher. Relevant certifications will be an advantage
  * **3-5 years** of experience in risk (includes compliance, financial crimes, operational risk, internal audit, legal, risk management, credit risk, market risk, IT systems security, business process management).
  * Experience in automation / advanced excel / reporting will be an advantage.
  * General knowledge of industry standards and best practices around control evaluations / testing, internal audit and risk management processes.
  * Experience assessing control design and performance through testing, audit or Risk Control Self-Assessment practices
  * Experience assessing processes, procedures and identifying controls
  * Experience in assessing risk, reviewing risk ratings, identifying control gaps and determining the appropriate evaluation methodology
  * Comprehensive understanding of operational risk management in the financial services (preferred) or other highly regulated industries
  * Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy.
  * Excellent verbal, written, interpersonal communication skills and stakeholder management.
  * Demonstrate positive attitude and readiness to work in a challenging and dynamic environment.
  * Flexibility to multi task and work across domains and business groups.
  * Ability to credibly challenge, conduct tough conversations and effectively communicate with various levels of management
  * Ability to synthesize data from a variety of sources and deliver results quickly

  * Design, maintain and execute the control evaluation scripts, identify control deficiencies, document and escalate potential issues to appropriate stakeholders.
  * Validate & track action plans, escalate issues as required and document the control test artifacts and findings.

an exciting, fast paced team working on cutting edge encryption, tokenization
and key management technologies that are leveraged to protect information

individual contributor, to teams that design, deploy, and operationally
maintain cryptographic products and services including Hardware Security
Modules (HSMs) and security appliances.

role in the development, implementation and execution of the Global Mergers &

Information and Material Non-Public Information.

  * Master the full operational life cycle of an M&A transaction and provide hands-on, day-to-day support to deal teams, ensuring compliance with both CIB and M&A specific policies and procedures
  * Assist in developing and implementing strategic solutions to complex and varied regulatory challenges and requirements
  * Enhance and strengthen the infrastructure and technology required for the delivery of a scalable risk and control program
  * Identify opportunities and strategies for process improvement and enhancing operational risk & control within M&A
  * Identify business trends and self-identify gaps where operational and compliance risks could materialize
  * Assist in all M&A internal and external audits, inquiries, and regulatory exams, globally
  * Collaborate with legal and compliance to understand their business strategies and goals, as well as key risks
  * Ensure broad education and adoption of the various M&A controls across CIB globally
  * Support CIB-wide initiatives, projects, and development of risk and control programs
  * Be fluent in all CIB policy and regulatory requirements and assess potential impact to M&A

have excellent organization and communication skills. They will be comfortable
engaging with stakeholders at all levels and working adaptably in a varied and
fast paced environment.

wellsfargojobs.com

description:
The Consumer Technology (CT) group executes the Wells Fargo Technology
strategy and offers a strategic technology perspective to the lines of
business we support. These LOBs include Auto; Card, Merchant Services; Home
Lending; Personal Loans and Retail Services within Consumer Lending. Our teams
provide technology solutions to the LOBs and manage the application portfolios
through the enablers of skills, stability, security, scalability, speed, and
success. A customer-focused organization that delivers the next generation of
payments capabilities; advances digital offerings; enables innovation to
develop new customer experiences and products; and enhances digital channels,
branches, contact centers, and ATM technologies.

**About this Role:**

Reporting to the Consumer Technology, Head of Platform Services, the Platform
Delivery Leader will collaborate with business CIOs to transform the existing
workforce into cross functional squads to build improved products across the
Consumer Technology Portfolio.  They will guide agile platform squads to
increase productivity and quality by learning and applying the right tools and
practices to become autonomous cross-functional teams. The Leader will
spearhead non-functional requirements to better understand how resilient our
systems are and guarantee availability of products and services.

sprint, delivering improved quality and speed through automation.

**Some of the key responsibilities will include:  **

quality outcomes:**

partnership with enabling teams including SRE, E &A and CTO: **

  * Cross-functional and co-located team support

  * Product knowledge and the ability to lead your teams to become expert knowledge holders themselves

  * Manage, measure, and enforce SRE maturity, expected Agile outcomes, automation standards, code quality and code coverage

  * Define and lead automation, DevOps, and risk avoidance efforts

  * Develop a T-shaped bench of engineering experts

  * Establish clear objectives and key results

  * Attract and grow diverse teams

  * Establish strong management functions and talent

  * Facilitate an environment for continuous technology learning and ‘fail fast’ culture

**Additional responsibilities may include:  **

  * Managing a team of engineering managers and leads

  * Focusing on delivering commitments aligned to enterprise strategic priorities

  * Building support for strategies with business and technology leader Guiding development of actionable roadmaps and plans

  * Identifying opportunities and strategies for continuous improvement of software engineering practices

  * Providing oversight to software craftsmanship, security, availability, resilience, and scalability of solutions developed by the teams or third-party providers

  * Setting risk management guidelines and partnering with stakeholders to implement key risk initiatives

description:

Wells Fargo is seeking experienced professional writers to join its Service
Communications team within Consumer, Small and Business Banking (CSBB)
Marketing. This new team will consist of innovative and experienced writers
that will transform all service communications across CSBB, resulting in
improved customer interactions and experiences. Learn more about our career

This role will have accountability for writing and editing new and existing
service communications, as well as partnering with Legal, Compliance, and
Product to ensure a consistent, accurate, and effective approach to all
communications.

  * Combine strategic thinking, messaging hierarchy, and personalization to break down complex service-related messages and turn them into simple, straightforward, modern messages and narratives that foster confidence in our brand.

Manage to the CSBB Service Communications style guide, writing guidelines and messaging hierarchy and become a go-to consultative source.   * 5+ years of Public Relations, Media Relations or Corporate Communications experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

title: Risk Analytics Director - Consumer and Small Business Banking, CRO
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Risk Analytics Director to lead the Data Innovation
and Risk Insights team within the Consumer, Small & Business Banking (CSBB)
Chief Risk Officer (CRO) organization.

This leader will be responsible for understanding and aggregating the business
needs across a wide set of users, designing a target-state set of business
requirements, as well as, setting and managing a multi-year roadmap.  As the
Data Innovation and Risk Insights Leader, you will be responsible for
developing and executing a data driven risk analytics infrastructure,
including data integrity, data aggregation, analysis, and interpretation to
support timely and effective statistically driven oversight of the CSBB
business.

This role will report directly to the Strategy, Planning & Governance Lead for
CSBB CRO and will manage a team of professionals focused on delivering
meaningful and actionable intelligence and producing data driven solutions in
response to business needs.  As a part of Wells Fargo's Independent Risk
Management team, this role leads the design and management of targeted data
driven oversight capabilities.

  
**In this role, you will:**

  * Lead the design and build of data innovation and risk insight strategy that supports both current and future reporting and analytic needs.
  * Leverage advanced techniques such as Visualization, Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) to develop and implement effective risk oversight.
  * Develop and maintain a roadmap for managing data quality, process improvement, report distribution, risk control development and success measurement standards.
  * Provide leadership in developing and ensuring adherence to a data integrity governance framework.

customers and partners while seamlessly integrating into the supply chain.

  * Engage and influence stakeholders, internal partners and peers associated with the Network Engineering function

  * Determine appropriate strategy and actions of Network Engineering team to meet moderate to high risk deliverables

  * Interpret and develop policies and procedures for Network Engineering functions with moderate complexity within scope of responsibility

  * 3+ years of Management experience

  * 6+ years of experience with Datacenter Networking technologies, Network Virtualization, LAN switching technology, routing protocols, SDWAN, or Wireless LAN

  * 6+ years of experience with Network hardware like switches, routers, and WLAN devices from industry leading equipment vendors

**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Digital Product Manager for the Consumer Digital
team. This is an individual contributor position in the Wells Fargo Consumer
Digital product management team with a focus on delivering best in class
mobile and online experiences related to DDA, Cash Accounts Opening &
Servicing, Messaging, Engagement & Self-Service Features.

The Strategy, Digital and Innovation (SDI) team forges the strategic direction
of Wells Fargo, provides, and manages our digital foundation and common
capabilities, transforming our business models to meet evolving customer needs
and grow the company. The investments we are making will help the company
create innovative digital banking experiences and make it easier for customers
to achieve their financial goals. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all
begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

For additional information on this line of business, refer to the external
Careers Site at [www.wellsfargojobs.com](http://www.wellsfargojobs.com)

  
**In this role, you will:**

  * Lead a scrum team focused on building digital experiences for retail banking clients
  * Work with internal and external stakeholders to identify product improvements and new product features
  * Drive and capture product requirements and write user stories
  * Collaborate with design partners on UX/UI development
  * Review and analyze complex content strategy/creation, customer experience, analytics/research or product management that require an in-depth evaluation of variable factors
  * Collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues, and mid-level managers to resolve issues and achieve goals
  * Review and update procedure and training documentation and launch communications
  * Identify opportunities to improve the client’s digital experience by reviewing research and feedback from Voice of Customer sources, user testing, and competitive intelligence
  * Participate in production validation and regression testing for code releases
  * Make decisions in digital strategy for product or functional area requiring strong understanding of the business, policies, procedures, and risk/compliance requirements

**Required Qualifications:**

  * 5+ years of digital product management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

  
**Desired Qualifications:**

  * Experience in the digital banking
  * Financial services or banking experience related to money management, accounts opening, digital adoption and engagement
  * Strong analytical skills with ability to draw conclusions and translate findings
  * Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
  * Ability to manage multiple and competing priorities
  * Ability to influence and manage cross functional work streams to execute projects with quality and on-time
  * Experience interpreting business and technical needs and translating them into user stories
  * Virtual leadership experience with ability to effectively drive results, provide feedback/direction, and manage and build relationships with leaders and team members in a geographically dispersed team environment

description:

    * Perform analytical review of reporting output, including provision of commentary as necessary

    * Handle issues and errors in line with International Controller and Enterprise-wide policies and procedures

description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Compliance Specialist

  
****In this role, you will:****

  * Establish, implement and maintain risk standards and programs to drive compliance with federal, state, agency, legal and regulatory and Corporate Policy requirements
  * Oversee the Front Line's execution and challenges appropriately on compliance related decisions

  * Provide direction to the business on developing corrective action plans and effectively managing regulatory change
  * Provide compliance risk expertise

  * Provide direction to the business on developing corrective action plans and effectively managing regulatory change
  * Report findings and make recommendations to management appropriate committees
  * Interpret policies, procedures, and compliance requirements

****Required Qualifications :****

description:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Database Engineer in the IT Service Operations
group.

  
****In this role, you will:****

Be a lead database engineer, specifically with highest technical expertise in
design, administration, high availability, and operational support experience
with the next generation database platforms like MongoDB, PostgreSQL,
YugabyteDB, will join a growing and high energy team supporting enterprise
Customers. As a Lead database Engineer, you will be responsible for providing
the highest technical expertise for the planning, design, implementation,
upgrade, patching, capacity planning, and day to day operations for the
NextGen database platforms including technical communications with the vendor.
This role will also provide oversight, mentoring, and leadership to less
experienced on-shore and off-shore staff. The successful candidate must be
comfortable working on multiple dynamic projects simultaneously, collaborating
with database architects, application teams, information security teams, and
leadership at all levels of the organization.

Responsibilities for this role in working on an enterprise team supporting
large, complex databases include the following:

Provide the highest technical expertise for the planning, analysis, design,
implementation, maintenance, and control of the organization's MongoDB and
PostgreSQL databases, engaging with DBA teams, architecture, Scrum Master,
Product and supporting teams to create efficient and consistent solutions.
Assure successful sprint and release planning following agile development
methodology. Lead the most complex or critical MongoDB initiatives that
typically involve multiple disciplines and multiple business groups, including
database architecture, other Core Engineering teams, design, integration,
and/or data modeling. Provide highest level of expertise in complex databases
troubleshooting and problem resolution and drive continuous process
improvement as preventive actions. Recommend improvements to web application
processing issues and design. As the recognized technical expert, consult
extensively with multiple client groups to provide strategic solutions,
influencing long-range internal and enterprise-level data/ database
architecture and management strategies. Design and certify next generation
database technologies and provide technical leadership and recommendation into
the future direction of database technology. Able to handle

  * 5+ years of Database Engineering experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

title: Lead Information Security Engineer Cryptography Products and Services
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a motivated Lead Information Security Engineer to join
an exciting, fast paced team working on cutting edge encryption, tokenization
and key management technologies that are leveraged to protect information
companywide.  This role will provide technical leadership, and be an
individual contributor, to teams that design, deploy, and operationally
maintain cryptographic products and services including Hardware Security
Modules (HSMs) and security appliances.

The ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience in the design and
deployment of cryptographic products in physical, virtual, and containerized
environments. The ideal candidate will also have demonstrated experience in
automating processes including product builds, operational maintenance, and
customer integration and onboarding.  This role reports directly to the Senior
Manager for the Encryption, Tokenization and Key Management team. Learn more
about the career areas and lines of business at wellsfargojobs.com

****In this role, you will:****

  * Provide technical guidance and oversight to teams and team members responsible for product delivery and operational maintenance

  * Develop and maintain documentation including design and build guides, deployment strategies, automation guides and operational processes

  * Participate in research, analysis and evaluation of new cryptographic products and services

  * Participate in Proof of Concept (POC) testing and demonstrations for new cryptographic products and services

  * Support company driven audits, gather evidence of compliance to company policies, and drive product enhancements, when needed, to remediate findings

  * Conduct technical investigation of incidents to identify causes and recommend future mitigation strategies

  * Collaborate across Wells Fargo teams, including compliance, security architecture and security evaluation teams to ensure cryptographic products are compliant to company policies

  * Work with vendors to understand the technology vendor's roadmap, help to influence that roadmap, and ensure requests for technology/product enhancements are meeting the needs of Wells Fargo

description:
**About Wells Fargo India**  
Wells Fargo India & Philippines (WFIP) enables global talent capabilities for
Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines
and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and
Knowledge Services. WFIP operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India
and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about WFIP at our International Careers
website.  


**Department Overview**  
  
We evaluate whether controls are well-designed and operating effectively. Our
approach is tailored around Risk and Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) and other
risk programs and it supports proactive risk management in alignment with the
Risk Management Framework. We perform evidence-based controls evaluations and
document our outcomes based on applicable policies and standards.  
  
**About the Role**  
  
The controls evaluation team performs evidence based control testing which may
involve sampling and inspecting evidence to assess the design and operating
effectiveness of controls and whether they are mitigating the assigned risks.

This role will help in strengthening the business control environment through
proactive evaluation of controls, identification of issues and by providing
consultative guidance to the front line business groups. For this role, we are
looking for a candidate with good understanding of risk management,
operational risk and control evaluation/testing methodologies with an ability
to assess the design and operating effectiveness of controls for medium to
high complex processes. The role requires engagement with multiple
stakeholders, providing credible challenge and an ability to identify and
report potential control gaps in the business processes.

  
**Responsibilities**

  * Individual contributor role focusing on performing evidence based control evaluations by conducting various evidence gathering activities.
  * Design, maintain and execute the control evaluation scripts, identify control deficiencies, document and escalate potential issues to appropriate stakeholders.
  * Validate & track action plans, escalate issues as required and document the control test artifacts and findings.
  * Mentor and guide junior associates, oversee the timely completion of all control evaluation activities and documentation.
  * Perform control evaluations for medium to complex engagements, challenge status-quo and identify opportunities to add efficiencies or refining the existing processes.
  * Engage and work with multiple stakeholders - front line business groups, risk program aligned functions and IRM teams for driving the objectives of risk and control programs.
  * Instill and drive proactive risk culture, operational excellence and efficiencies.

**Essential Qualifications**

  * **1****0+ years** of experience in risk (includes compliance, financial crimes, operational risk, internal audit, risk management, legal, credit risk, market risk, IT systems security, business process management),
  * Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy.
  * Excellent verbal, written, interpersonal communication skills and stakeholder management.
  * Demonstrate positive attitude and readiness to work in a challenging and dynamic environment.
  * Flexibility to multi task and work across domains and business groups.
  * Proven experience in leading control testing efforts, mentoring junior associates and driving results.
  * Ability to credibly challenge, conduct tough conversations and effectively communicate with various levels of management, including senior leaders and executives

**Desired Qualifications**

  * Bachelor's degree or higher. Relevant certifications will be an advantage
